body.name: Cryptid Kids: The Bawk-ness Monster (Cryptid Kids, 1)
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews Review "Awash in silly asides, with the antics and kooky gadgetry of a 007 flick, this watery romp lands its affirmation that living authentically is possible for everyone―even cryptids."―Booklist About the Author Natalie Riess is a cartoonist from Pennsylvania. She now lives in Austin, TX, where she makes comics with her girlfriend and gets yelled at by their beautiful cat. She loves to draw food, nature, and horrible plant monsters. Her previous titles include Space Battle Lunchtime and Snarlbear.Sara Goetter is a Pennsylvania-born, currently Austin-based cartoonist, where she draws comics with her girlfriend. She specializes in drawing goofy faces and dumb jokes, and cries whenever she thinks about frogs too much.

body.description: Penny swears that when she was a little girl, a creature called the Bawk-ness Monster―half sea serpent, half chicken―saved her from drowning. Now, years later, she’s about to move away to a new city, and before she goes, she needs the help of her best friends, Luc and K, for a vitally important mission: seeing “Bessie” one more time. But in their quest to find Bessie and give Penny the send-off she deserves, the kids stumble into a whole new problem―cryptids are being kidnapped by an evil collector, and only Penny, Luc, and K can save them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Bawk-ness Monster is not scary.
reviews.reviewText: I like the Bawk-ness Monster, because it’s about kids that get to go out adventure and make the world a better place. It’s really cool that I got to meet the authors of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Gender ideology for children
reviews.reviewText: Absolute trash. This book pushes gender ideology on CHILDREN. Glad I read it before giving it to my child. It's in the garbage now where it belongs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: 4 stars = Great! Might re-read.What a hoot! I loved the kids in this and the fun cryptids. The art isn't a style that I prefer, but it was easy to follow and the story had the chance to shine a little more for me. Bessie and BB are great - I would absolutely read a sequel!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So fun for kids and adults
reviews.reviewText: Another fantastic adventure by this duo! When I saw they were releasing a new graphic novel I didn’t even think I pre ordered right away and it didn’t disappoint!Can’t wait for my kids to read it I know they’re going to love it too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fun graphic novel
reviews.reviewText: Three years ago Penny fell into Lake Boxamixon and was saved by the legendary Bessie the Bawk-ness Monster. Now Penny and her mom are moving and Penny wants to thank Bessie for saving her. She convinces her mom to take her and friends Luc and K on a camping trip where they will sneak away and find Bessie. Things do not go as planned and soon they are all wrapped up in a cryptids kidnapping scheme. Lots of adventure!
